description.plain: Shad Moss (b. March 9, 1987), better known as Bow Wow, is an American rapper and television personality from west Ohio. At the wholesome age of 10, he won the hearts of audiences everywhere with his early 2000’s singles Bounce With Me and Bow Wow (That’s My Name), supported by production from his mentor and So So Def label boss, Jermaine Dupri. His career was later studded with 5 albums, and dozens of hit singles, most popular of which being “Like You” featuring Ciara in 2005, and “Let Me Hold You” by frequent collaborator Omarion in 2006. He will be releasing his final album this year, currently dubbed NYLTH.

songs.full_title: Like You by Bow Wow (Ft. Ciara)
songs.title: Like You

description.plain:
“Like You” is the second single and fourth track released off of Bow Wow’s album Wanted.  It was written by Jermaine Dupri, Jaron Alston, and Johnta Austin, and produced by Dupri and Bryan Michael Cox. The song samples the keyboard chord of New Edition’s “I’m Leaving You Again”. The song reached number 3 on the Billboard Hot 100 and number 1 on the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart. To date, “Like You” remains Bow Wow’s highest charting song.



Around the time the two artist were dating and it was only right the two did a duet. The mixture of R&B & Hip Hop duets were huge. This song was one of the biggest nostalgic hits of the 2000’s.

songs.full_title: Let Me Hold You by Bow Wow (Ft. Omarion)
songs.title: Let Me Hold You

description.plain:
On “Let Me Hold You,” Bow Wow enlists the help of friend and former B2K member Omarion as they serenade girls and promise to “hold them down.”

In a 2005 interview with MTV, Bow Wow spoke of the track saying:

Basically the song is me talking to a girl and telling her, ‘These are the things I can do for you. Let me hold you down. This is what I want to do for you as a man. These are the things I’m capable of doing for you if you get with me. Just hear me out.’ I’m just really talking to the ladies. The song is really special to me, and I love that song.

The track was the first single off Bow Wow’s fourth studio album Wanted, and preceded The Scream IV tour with Omarion, Pretty Ricky, B-5, Bobby Valentino and Marques Houston.

songs.title: Shortie Like Mine
songs.title_with_featured: Shortie Like Mine (Ft. Chris Brown & Johntá Austin)

description.plain:
“Shortie Like Mine” is an ode to the irreplaceable woman in Bow’s life, American singer Ciara who Bow dated from 2004-2006. The track was released as the lead single from Bow’s fifth album, The Price of Fame.

“Shortie Like Mine” features R&B singer Chris Brown and rapper Johntá Austin, and marks Chris' first single as a featured artist. The track also marks the second collaboration between Bow and Chris, following November 2005’s “Run It! (Remix)”

“Shortie Like Mine” peaked at #9 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart the week of December 16, 2006, and is certified Platinum by the RIAA.

songs.full_title: Ain’t Thinkin’ 'Bout You by Bow Wow (Ft. Chris Brown)
songs.title: Ain’t Thinkin’ ’Bout You

description.plain:
Single from Bow Wow’s Cash Money debut Underrated. Bow Wow and Chris Brown vent their feelings about their breakups with Ciara and Rihanna respectively

Chris Brown has rebounded better, releasing a bunch of hot tracks (“Deuces”, “Yeah 3x”, “Look at Me Now”, “No Bullshit”, “She Ain’t You”, “Beautiful People”) and a successful album F.A.M.E.

Bow Wow got caught tricking on Twitter and is delaying his solo effort on Cash Money. Funny how he sounds kind of desperate on this track

songs.full_title: Outta My System by Bow Wow (Ft. Johntá Austin & T-Pain)
songs.title: Outta My System
songs.title_with_featured: Outta My System (Ft. Johntá Austin & T-Pain)

description.plain:
On “Outta My System,” Bow Wow enlists T-Pain as he addresses his break up with long time partner Ciara over alleged cheating rumors with Ashley R.–a video vixen and one of Ciara’s friends.

Bow Wow cleared the air on a 2007 interview with MTV stating that:

It deals with a situation I was in, for sure. It doesn’t take a rocket scientist to listen to that song and know what I’m talking about or who I’m talking to. That’s why I did it. That once again deals with the price of fame.

The track marked his second single off his fifth studio album The Price of Fame and samples Rick James' 1978 funk record “Hollywood.”

songs.full_title: Bounce With Me by Bow Wow (Ft. Jermaine Dupri & Xscape)
songs.title: Bounce With Me
songs.title_with_featured: Bounce With Me (Ft. Jermaine Dupri & Xscape)

description.plain: “Bounce with Me” is a single by American rapper Lil' Bow Wow featuring Xscape. It is Lil' Bow Wow’s debut single, taken from his debut album Beware of Dog. The single samples “Love Serenade (Part II)” by Barry White. It spent nine weeks at number 1 on the U.S. Rap Chart and number 20 on Billboard Hot 100. The song was featured in the film Big Momma’s House and the trailer of Hardball. A radio remix and extended version featuring R.O.C. and Lil' Mo was also released.

songs.full_title: My Baby by Bow Wow (Ft. Jagged Edge)
songs.title: My Baby

description.plain:
My Baby is the second single by Bow Wow from his 2003 album Unleashed and features guest vocals from R&B group and Columbia labelmates Jagged Edge.

The song, along with the accompanying music video, details about how he met a girl that is in an abusive relationship.

songs.full_title: I'm a Flirt by Bow Wow (Ft. R. Kelly)
songs.title: I’m a Flirt

description.plain:
This is the last and hidden song on Bow Wow’s “The Price of Fame” album. This song is the original version of the song before R. Kelly made a remix version of the song where he mostly sings all the lyrics with other artist then Bow Wow.
This was explained in Michael Paoletta’s “Inside Track” column in the March 3, 2007 print edition of the magazine:
“Versions of the song have been recorded by both Bow Wow and R. Kelly. Bow Wow’s version features Kelly, who co-penned the track, while Kelly’s version features T.I. and T-Pain. Due to the similar characteristics of each song, the plays for both versions will be totalled under one chart listing. “I’m a Flirt” first appeared on Bow Wow’s Columbia/Sony Music album ‘The Price of Fame’ as a bonus hidden track. iTunes shoppers, though, can purchase the track as a single, as Columbia has download rights—but not the singles rights to promote it to radio. Kelly’s 2007 album ‘Double Up’ includes his version of the song.

See here for the difference:
https://youtu.be/XjhnQ3ZwWKw

https://youtu.be/AV1kM9ifb-M

songs.title: BET Rapcity Freestyle

description.plain:
This freestyle by Bow Wow in BET’s rap city is about Bow Wow’s ambitions in getting many Hollywood chicks, and the theoretical complications of his actions. The instrumental is Right Thurr by Chingy



His list includes but is not limited to: Pamela Lee, Kelis, Chilli, Jamet, Chante Moore, Jennifer Anison, Jennifer Lopez, Halle Berry, Tamia, Kyla Pratt, Kyla Pratt, Beyoncé, Nivea, Christina Milian, Jennifer Freeman, Meagan Good, ….

Damd, that’s some real ambition!

description.plain:
This is the return of Bow Wow on Rap Scene after an “acting break” like he’s tellin. Produced by the rising aussie star DJ Willi, and with video shot in Australia, Bow Wow came back to hit the club with that track surely inspired by the Mustard beat.



See the BTS here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AuyLMogM7uw

description.plain:
‘Put That On My Hood’ was featured in the 2010 comedy, Lottery Ticket. Shad Moss was also the lead role in the movie! A man of many talents.

‘Put That On My Hood’ may have been inspired by Jeezy’s ‘My hood’. “it’s understood, I do this for the hood”



Check out the official ‘Put That On My Hood’ music video!

http://vimeo.com/13766199

songs.full_title: Ain’t Thinkin’ ’Bout You (Extended Version) by Bow Wow (Ft. Chris Brown)
songs.title: Ain’t Thinkin’ ’Bout You (Extended Version)
songs.title_with_featured: Ain’t Thinkin’ ’Bout You (Extended Version) (Ft. Chris Brown)

description.plain:
Single from Bow Wow’s Cash Money debut Underrated. Bow Wow and Chris Brown vent their feelings about their breakups with Ciara and Rihanna respectively

Chris Brown has rebounded better, releasing a bunch of hot tracks (“Deuces”, “Yeah 3x”, “Look at Me Now”, “No Bullshit”, “She Ain’t You”, “Beautiful People”) and a successful album F.A.M.E.

Bow Wow got caught tricking on Twitter and is delaying his solo effort on Cash Money. Funny how he sounds kind of desperate on this track

songs.full_title: I'm Da Man by Bow Wow (Ft. Chris Brown)
songs.title: I’m Da Man

description.plain:
A track that was leaked online in 2011 with “The Prince of R&B Chris Brown and The Prince of Hip-Hop Bow Wow.”

This track follows the previously collaborated on “Shortie Like Mine” and “Ain’t Thinkin' ‘Bout You” and deals with life in the fast lane.

songs.full_title: Marco Polo (Remix) by Bow Wow (Ft. Soulja Boy & V.I.C.)
songs.title: Marco Polo (Remix)

description.plain:
Following up to the success of Bow Wow’s hit single, “Marco Polo”, featuring fellow rapper/producer, Soulja Boy, Bow Wow recruits him and V.I.C. to hop on the official remix of the hit single.

Originally, Bow Wow announced that a remix of the song would feature big named rappers, such as T-Pain, Lil Wayne, Twista, Busta Rhymes, and an up-and-coming Australian rapper, Yung Zimmie. However, the remix was never released, either to be scrapped in it’s entirety or left unreleased for years.
